choices.entry_0001: I have something to tell both of you.
choices.entry_0002: There's something I need to tell just you first.
choices.entry_0006: We just study together, that's all.
choices.entry_0007: Mom, Jack is... more than a friend.

choices.entry_0009: Oops, I meant he's just a studymate.
choices.entry_0010: Well, he can also be my friend...
choices.entry_0011: No, I always said we were friends.
choices.entry_0012: Oh. No, yeah, we're just friends.
choices.entry_0013: The wrong idea might be the right idea.
choices.entry_0014: What do you mean by... wrong idea?
choices.entry_0016: Don't say that about my friend!
choices.entry_0017: What do you mean, he's not natural?
choices.entry_0018: Ha, he sure acts gay. Luckily, he's not.
choices.entry_0020: Maybe... my friend might be gay.

dinner_2.string_0004: Oh, you started eating without me. You're very impatient.
dinner_2.string_0006: You could have started without me. No need to let your food get cold.
dinner_2.string_0008: It's immature to play with your food, you know.
dinner_2.string_0010: Your father's running late. He'll be joining us for dinner in an hour's time.
dinner_2.string_0014: Alright. Tell us both later when he comes back.
dinner_2.string_0016: So, what's your plans for tomorrow?
dinner_2.string_0017: Hold on Nick, I haven't asked about your day yet!
dinner_2.string_0019: Okay. And what's your plans for tomorrow?
dinner_2.string_0025: You really, really could improve your grades in your {0} class.
dinner_2.string_0026: So, I'll be at the library tomorrow.
dinner_2.string_0027: Will I see you studying there?
dinner_2.string_0028: Actually, I'm gonna study at Jack's place.
dinner_2.string_0030: You spend a lot of time with him.
dinner_2.string_0033: So you're just hanging out, not studying.
dinner_2.string_0035: Alright, just don't lie to me.
dinner_2.string_0037: Oh. So you're just hanging out, not studying.
dinner_2.string_0041: I thought you said you 'just study together'.
dinner_2.string_0042: You didn't tell me you were friends.
dinner_2.string_0043: Just... don't hang around him too much.
dinner_2.string_0044: People might get the wrong idea.
dinner_2.string_0048: But... about you hanging out with Jack.
dinner_2.string_0049: It's just that some people might assume things, since...
dinner_2.string_0052: Just between mother and son, I think he might be... you know...
dinner_2.string_0055: He looks and talks like a gay.
dinner_2.string_0056: Oh, that's like a zen thing, right?
dinner_2.string_0058: Zen is also about nature, and your classmate Jack, he...
dinner_2.string_0062: But yes, even you agree that it's bad to be seen as 'not natural'.
dinner_2.string_0064: And I'm just looking out for you! Because he acts like, you know...
dinner_2.string_0066: And since you say he's a 'good pal'...
dinner_2.string_0067: People might think you're a gay like him, too.
dinner_2.string_0068: And since you say he's your BEST friend...
dinner_2.string_0069: See? You also think there's something not right about it.
dinner_2.string_0072: I'm not saying those kind of people are bad!
dinner_2.string_0073: I just think... you should be careful around one of them.
dinner_2.string_0074: Jack might, you know, try to recruit you.
dinner_2.string_0077: Nick, I'm sorry you find me annoying.
dinner_2.string_0079: Let's go back to talking about your grades.
dinner_2.string_0080: Now, what did you say you were studying tomorrow?
dinner_2.string_0082: You first told me it was {0}.
dinner_2.string_0085: This is TWICE you've lied to me during this dinner.
dinner_2.string_0087: Either way, your grades in both subjects are terrible.
dinner_2.string_0088: You hesitated for a moment there.
dinner_2.string_0090: I wonder if you're studying with Jack at all, or just always hanging out.
dinner_2.string_0092: Still, your grades in your {0} class are terrible.

choices.entry_0000: That's why I'm studying more with Jack.
choices.entry_0001: Look, I'm trying. I really am.

choices.entry_0004: Are you trying to matchmake me with her?

dinner_3.string_0001: I'm worried for you. Jack's not a good influence.
dinner_3.string_0002: I think his parents might even be drug addicts...
dinner_3.string_0004: All he does is do poetry.
dinner_3.string_0005: I'm getting you a home tutor.
dinner_3.string_0007: She'll be tutoring you in {0} and {1}.
dinner_3.string_0009: Her name is Claire. She's smart, pretty, and Caucasian. She's your age, too.
dinner_3.string_0011: Be careful how you say that. You make it sound like...
dinner_3.string_0015: Okay. Just being clear about some things.
dinner_3.string_0021: I never said you were, but... okay.
dinner_3.string_0025: Well, if that's what you want, I could!
dinner_3.string_0027: Don't be shy! You're growing up to be a man.
dinner_3.string_0028: And you're going to give me lots of grandkids.
dinner_3.string_0032: I ironed your best clothes. You'll make a good first impression.
dinner_3.string_0035: As in I AM SEXUALLY ATTRACTED TO BOTH MEN AND WOMEN.
dinner_3.string_0036: You'll change your mind when you grow up.
dinner_3.string_0037: Raising a child is wonderful. Your children will look up to you!
dinner_3.string_0041: No, because I've already scheduled Claire to come over tomorrow.
dinner_3.string_0043: No. I promised to study with Jack tomorrow.
dinner_3.string_0044: How long did you want to stay over at his place?
dinner_3.string_0045: It's not weird. Friends have sleepovers all the time.
dinner_3.string_0046: I knew it. I caught your lie earlier.
dinner_3.string_0049: You're just hanging out with him.
dinner_3.string_0050: That's not enough to really get studying done.
dinner_3.string_0051: Claire will be tutoring you every day after school, starting tomorrow.
dinner_3.string_0053: Also Claire can be your friend. Maybe more than friends.
dinner_3.string_0057: Okay. Good that this is all settled now.
dinner_3.string_0059: Well, if you also want to hang out with her, that's good too.
dinner_3.string_0060: Anything to make you more manly.
dinner_3.string_0066: I think it's not just Jack, it's the entire school that's a bad influence on you.
dinner_3.string_0068: The whole Canadian culture is making you confused about who you are.
dinner_3.string_0071: I'm your MOTHER, it's my right to do whatever I want with you!
dinner_3.string_0072: And watch it, I could change my mind and start homeschooling you.
dinner_3.string_0073: Yesterday, when you were supposedly studying with Jack?
dinner_3.string_0074: I know you secretly went off to watch a movie.
dinner_3.string_0075: Yes. See how smart you can be when you're not with Jack?
dinner_3.string_0076: You are a very stubborn boy.
dinner_3.string_0078: Because I read your text messages.
dinner_3.string_0079: Before dinner. I was in your room.
dinner_3.string_0080: You yelled out {0} from downstairs, while I unlocked your phone...
dinner_3.string_0081: And read what you and Jack have been sending to each other.
dinner_3.string_0082: I'm your mother. I have the right.
dinner_3.string_0085: Helping you lie to your own mother?
dinner_3.string_0086: What else have you been doing behind my back?
dinner_3.string_0091: You're my child, of course I forgive you.

choices.entry_0000: Yeah, coz Dad's SUCH a great role model.

dinner_5.string_0003: Sup dad, how was your day?
dinner_5.string_0004: Stayed overtime. Hopefully the boss will notice it before my Performance Review.
dinner_5.string_0005: Really, though, I was just playing web games all day. Haha!

dinner_5.string_0008: Well then! You have a sick sense of fun, don't you. Haha!
dinner_5.string_0011: BAD games aren't any fun. Haha!

dinner_5.string_0014: Hey Qi, what's that sauce on your plate?

dinner_5.string_0018: Her food insults itself plenty enough. Haha!
dinner_5.string_0020: Show some respect. Have more faith in your mother's cooking!
dinner_5.string_0021: Because the way she cooks, we could certainly use a miracle! Haha!
dinner_5.string_0025: Well, you've cooked up worse, hun. Haha!
dinner_5.string_0029: What about your poor grades in {0} and {1}?
dinner_5.string_0030: What about your poor grades in {0}?
dinner_5.string_0031: Nick and I were just talking about that.
dinner_5.string_0032: Don't you remember? I just grounded you for tomorrow.

dinner_5.string_0034: You must get your stupid from your mother's side. Haha!
dinner_5.string_0036: I'm bumping it up. You're now grounded for a week.
dinner_5.string_0037: I'm bumping it up. You're now grounded for TWO weeks.
dinner_5.string_0040: BICYCLING to school every day starting next week.
dinner_5.string_0042: You could certainly lose some weight, or else how will you get a girlfriend?
dinner_5.string_0043: You must get your chubbiness from your mother. Haha!
dinner_5.string_0045: We were discussing probably getting a home tutor.
dinner_5.string_0046: Oh! Is this the Claire kid?
dinner_5.string_0047: Mom, we both promised we wouldn't talk about this...
dinner_5.string_0049: Mom, you said we wouldn't talk about this...
dinner_5.string_0050: You're the one who didn't promise not to talk!
dinner_5.string_0051: Mom, you said you wouldn't talk about this if I didn't...
dinner_5.string_0053: I'm the head of this household. You two better not be hiding secrets from me.
dinner_5.string_0054: Oh... Nick just really, really likes Claire.
dinner_5.string_0055: Don't be so shy about it.
dinner_5.string_0056: Yes son! You're going to be a boyfriend!
dinner_5.string_0059: If I were your age, I ditch your mother and chase Claire, too! Haha!
dinner_5.string_0061: Talking back? Careful, I'll box your ears, boy!
dinner_5.string_0062: We were also thinking about changing schools for Nick.
dinner_5.string_0064: Claire will be tutoring Nick every day after school in {0} and {1}.
dinner_5.string_0065: Claire will be tutoring Nick every day after school in {0}.
dinner_5.string_0066: Nick, how does all this sound? Yes or no?
dinner_5.string_0068: Shut up, Qi. I asked my son.
dinner_5.string_0070: You want to change schools to chase your hot tutor girlfriend?
dinner_5.string_0071: You want to spend all your after-school hours with your hot tutor girlfriend?
dinner_5.string_0077: You two seem to have made this big life decision very eagerly!
dinner_5.string_0078: So eagerly, in fact, you made it in less than an hour, and tried to hide it from me. What a sudden change.
dinner_5.string_0079: Nick, you did something naughty, didn't you?
dinner_5.string_0082: Yeah, you need to get your grades back up.
dinner_5.string_0083: Or you'll be stuck in a teaching job like your mother! Haha!
dinner_5.string_0088: Wait, uh, you didn't get her pregnant, did you?
dinner_5.string_0090: Good. Otherwise you'd be stuck for the next two decades raising a kid, like me! Haha!
dinner_5.string_0091: For a moment there, Nick, I thought you'd been smoking pot with your hippie classmate Jack, or something!
dinner_5.string_0093: Who wants to watch a movie this weekend? I hear Inception is good.
dinner_5.string_0095: Hey Nick, you know who's acting in the movie?
dinner_5.string_0098: Doesn't Claire look a little bit like her?
dinner_5.string_0100: What, Inception too complicated for you?
dinner_5.string_0102: Sure, I understand if you failed {0} and {1}...
dinner_5.string_0103: Sure, I understand if you failed {0}...
dinner_5.string_0104: But come on, this is a movie!
dinner_5.string_0105: You can't have inherited that much stupid from your mother's side! Haha!
dinner_5.string_0107: You went on a little movie date with your special friend Claire, didn't you?
dinner_5.string_0109: A date with my special friend.
dinner_5.string_0112: No. Mom's doing this so I can't see Jack anymore.
dinner_5.string_0115: Jack did this to our son!
dinner_5.string_0116: That kid chose his lifestyle, but I will not have it be yours, Nick.
dinner_5.string_0118: And his parents are drug addicts!
dinner_5.string_0119: Jack chose that lifestyle, but I will not have it be yours, Nick.
dinner_5.string_0121: Jack acts like the woman, not him...
dinner_5.string_0122: Nick's not fully gay, he told me himself he's still attracted to girls!
dinner_5.string_0123: Earlier Nick told me he was just confused!
dinner_5.string_0125: Look, like I told Mom just now, I'm your SON, isn't that enou--
dinner_5.string_0128: Your mother and I will do random checks on your texts and emails.
dinner_5.string_0130: I swear, if I have to pay Claire extra to make you realize you're straight, I will.
dinner_5.string_0131: When I was crying earlier, he accused it of being fake!
dinner_5.string_0132: Qi, shut up. We're not talking about you.
dinner_5.string_0133: When I was crying earlier, he was mocking it!
dinner_5.string_0135: Would you like to say anything, anything at all, about all that?
dinner_5.string_0139: Fuck BOTH of you, you narcissistic slimy pieces of SHI--
dinner_5.string_0140: Good. At least you're taking this like a man.
dinner_5.string_0142: I'm going out to the bar, and getting something actually edible to eat.
dinner_5.string_0143: Honey sweetie dear? Your cooking is shit.
dinner_5.string_0148: At least you're standing up to me. Like a man.

jack_1.string_0009: You're a bit of a downer, aren't you?

jack_1.string_0012: Coz that's got to be the cheesiest thing I've ever said.

jack_1.string_0020: I believe that was the purpose.
jack_1.string_0022: I'll interpret that as a yes.

jack_1.string_0044: Hope I can convince the parents to let me out overnight.

jack_1.string_0046: I'll pretend we'll be cramming for the midterms all nigh-- huh?
jack_1.string_0047: You can't keep hiding like this.
jack_1.string_0050: I can help you be ready.
jack_1.string_0051: Nicky, hiding like this is eating away at your soul.
jack_1.string_0052: Like you said, what's the point of living a lie?

jack_1.string_0055: I know you weren't joking. Not really.

jack_1.string_0059: LIKE I SAID, you and your parents are a bunch of new-age hippies.

choices.entry_0000: Jack... we messed up big time, Jack.

jack_2.string_0001: Hello, Nicky darling. Still a sad sack of sadness?
jack_2.string_0003: How was coming out to your parents? Did I tell you so, or did I tell you so?
jack_2.string_0005: You're kidding me, right? What happened?
jack_2.string_0007: I didn't expect that they'd... what... what happened?
jack_2.string_0008: Ha, yes, I knew I was right!
jack_2.string_0009: No. Jack, we can't see each other ever again.
jack_2.string_0011: No, no, no. You're kidding me, right? What happened?
jack_2.string_0012: Well, my dad's oblivious. For now. But my mom...
jack_2.string_0014: Nicky, you need to call Child Protective Services.
jack_2.string_0015: What?! No. That's way too much.
jack_2.string_0016: Just... okay, but at least promise me you'll visit the school counselor tomorrow?
jack_2.string_0020: Why?! Why are they doing that?
jack_2.string_0021: Because 'Jack and the school is a bad influence on me', or something. They just want to break us up.
jack_2.string_0024: Her name's Claire Something. She'll also be tutoring me.
jack_2.string_0025: Ew squared, they're also hooking you up with your own tutor?
jack_2.string_0028: Wait, what will you do with these texts right now, then?
jack_2.string_0029: I can hide them better. My parents aren't exactly a tech-savvy bunch.
jack_2.string_0031: And that's just one out of three crappy things that happened.
jack_2.string_0034: This is my fault. I urged you to come out to your parents. Stupid me.
jack_2.string_0035: If you hadn't been all so 'ohhhh Nicky coming out is good for the soul' and shit, this never would have...
jack_2.string_0036: I'm sorry. You're the only person I can lash out on.
jack_2.string_0038: They already read our texts. Anything I would have said after that couldn't change what happened.
jack_2.string_0039: What! You didn't tell me they also read your texts!
jack_2.string_0040: And they're stuck in their old-fashioned moralities, the poor things.
jack_2.string_0041: I wouldn't go so far as to pity them.
jack_2.string_0042: I should have passcode-locked my phone, or use encrypted text, or hid it better...
jack_2.string_0044: Nicky, you had every right to trust them, they're your parents. They abused that trust. It's not your fault.
jack_2.string_0046: You know... talking with my parents, it's like...
jack_2.string_0048: It's imprecise, impersonal, impossible to truly connect.
jack_2.string_0050: I'll set up a new email and virtual phone number to talk with you.
jack_2.string_0051: This way they can't spy on our communications anymore.
jack_2.string_0052: I'll tell Claire everything. With any luck, she'll help me fight back.
jack_2.string_0053: I'll figure out a way, somehow...
jack_2.string_0054: Like I promised. Like you made me promise.
jack_2.string_0055: My current school, that is. I don't know how soon they'll be transferring me.
jack_2.string_0056: At least they'll be someone else I can lash out on.
jack_2.string_0057: Not running away, I mean. Although if I did I could crash at your place.
jack_2.string_0058: But anyway. I'm going to try to get an internship or scholarship in the US.
jack_2.string_0059: And get far, far away from these people.
jack_2.string_0060: No, I mean... what now, between us?
jack_2.string_0062: What do we do? What... What happens?
jack_2.string_0064: I can't do this to you, Jack. I can't pull you down with me.
jack_2.string_0065: At least, don't type 'we can still be friends'.
jack_2.string_0067: Because, of course we're friends. Of course we are.
jack_2.string_0070: There's a lot I need to sleep on, now.

choices.entry_0002: Hm, tell me more. (About This Game)
choices.entry_0003: With flowers and rainbows and gay unicorns?
choices.entry_0004: Apparently, with you redditing at Starbucks.
choices.entry_0006: How can I win a game with no right answers?
choices.entry_0007: You're a bit of a downer, aren't you?
choices.entry_0008: This 'true' game is full of lies?
choices.entry_0009: Speaking of which, let's play that! Now!
choices.entry_0010: Speaking of that, can we play it now?
choices.entry_0011: Why'd you make this? (About This Game)
choices.entry_0012: Let's just play this game already.
choices.entry_0013: Bad puns aside, can we play now?

menu.string_0002: Hey there, player. Welcome to this game, I guess.
menu.string_0003: What would you like to do now?
menu.string_0007: No messing around with reading the Credits or the About This Game sections or--
menu.string_0011: Why did you make that a clickable option, when it was the only option left.
menu.string_0014: Let's travel back four years ago, to 2010...
menu.string_0016: ...to the evening that changed my life forever.
menu.string_0017: Tell me, dear player, how do you think this all ends?
menu.string_0018: Yes. That is exactly how this game ends.
menu.string_0021: Hey, I'm coding on this laptop. Turning my coming-of-age story into the game you're playing right now.
menu.string_0026: Uh, compared to that, I guess my story isn't that tragic.
menu.string_0027: Although that's kind of a glass one-hundredths-full interpretation.
menu.string_0029: If you didn't skip the About This Game section, you'd know this is a very personal story.
menu.string_0030: This game includes dialogue that I, my parents, and my ex-boyfriend actually said.
menu.string_0031: As well as all the things we could have, should have, and never would have said.
menu.string_0032: It doesn't matter which is which.
menu.string_0035: LIFE is a bit of a downer.
menu.string_0037: Even if the dialogue was 100% accurate, it'd still be 100% lies.
menu.string_0038: You'll be playing as me, circa 2010.
menu.string_0039: Because you skipped the Credits, my (not-yet-legal) name is Nicky Case. Just so you know.
menu.string_0040: This game doesn't end with gay unicorns.
menu.string_0041: This game is a coming-out, a coming-of-age, a coming-to-terms.
menu.string_0042: This game ends not in blood, but in tears.
menu.string_0043: Sorry for being a bit of a downer.
menu.string_0044: And there are no right answers.
menu.string_0049: Every character will remember everything you say. Or don't say.
menu.string_0050: Yeah. You even brought up my choices in this MAIN MENU.
menu.string_0051: Some things are hard not to remember.
menu.string_0052: Ah, how rude of me! Let me introduce myself.
menu.string_0054: That's not my legal name, it's just my REAL name.
menu.string_0056: And like you just told me, this is your personal story?
menu.string_0058: Yep, I am the sole writer / programmer / artist of Coming Out Simulator 2014.
menu.string_0060: I said it before and I'll say it again...
menu.string_0063: The sounds & audio are from various public domain sources.
menu.string_0064: The sounds & audio, though, are from various public domain sources.
menu.string_0065: But although it's mostly just me behind this game...
menu.string_0066: ...there's a lot of people behind this game's story.
menu.string_0068: I wanted to tell my story.
menu.string_0073: Actually no, a narcissist would use their real name.
menu.string_0074: I told you, it IS my real na--
menu.string_0076: I made this game for the #Nar8 Game Jam. Gave me an excuse. And a deadline!
menu.string_0077: You procrastinated until the last day to enter, didn't you.
menu.string_0079: Also! This game is uncopyrighted. Dedicated to the public domain.
menu.string_0080: I'm as open with my source code as I am with my sexuality.

choices.entry_0001: Aw, come on, that's cold dude.
choices.entry_0002: Can't say I didn't see that coming...

choices.entry_0010: This story is a fractal of fracked up.
choices.entry_0013: And the Bay Area is very LGBT friendly.
choices.entry_0014: Oh, I love EA! They make The Sims, right?
choices.entry_0015: A mirror version of you, but reversed...
choices.entry_0016: So, you taught each other the other side?

outro.string_0000: And then we broke up three days later.
outro.string_0001: And then we broke up three weeks later.
outro.string_0003: Told you this didn't end in gay unicorns.
outro.string_0004: Told you. Not blood, but tears.
outro.string_0005: You were right. I'm a bit of a downer.
outro.string_0006: Let the feels flow, my friend.
outro.string_0008: Yeah... Jack and I saw it coming, too.
outro.string_0010: I feel gross just using the same-coloured dialogue balloons as the Father character.
outro.string_0011: Which reminds me. Many of the characters have been swapped around.
outro.string_0012: All names have been changed, except mine.
outro.string_0013: I left my little brother out entirely, because he's innocent.
outro.string_0014: And I put my Father back in, even though he'd left the family long before 2010.
outro.string_0015: Like you said, this 'true' game is full of lies.
outro.string_0016: You could have at least given me a different colour.
outro.string_0017: It's been four years since that night...
outro.string_0018: What do you think happened afterwards?
outro.string_0019: Don't worry. Like we said in the Main Menu, there are no right answers.
outro.string_0020: Alright, I will tell you what happened.
outro.string_0023: Yes, actually! In all three versions of what happened.
outro.string_0024: Yes, actually! At least, in one of my three versions of what happened.
outro.string_0026: Which post-coming-out story do you want to hear first?
outro.string_0027: Don't worry, you'll get to hear all three of them.
outro.string_0028: Now, which version do you want to hear next?
outro.string_0029: Finally, let's hear the last story...
outro.string_0030: Again, with the making the only option a clickable option...
outro.string_0031: Why did you make that a clickable option, when it was the only option left.
outro.string_0034: I ran away from home, with nothing more than a luggage bag full of edible underwear.
outro.string_0035: I roamed the Great White North. Supporting myself by writing amateur poetry for strangers.
outro.string_0036: I roamed the Great White North. Supporting myself by making not-fun web games.
outro.string_0037: I ate flowers. Followed the rainbows. And befriended a homosexual unicorn.
outro.string_0038: Eventually I made it to Alaska, where I met an adult bisexual couple named Bonnie & Clyde.
outro.string_0039: Bonnie was a mid-30s cougar, and Clyde was an early-40s manther.
outro.string_0040: And thanks to my flexibility, the luggage bag doubles as housing!
outro.string_0043: They took me in as their foster child, and I was their full-time boytoy.
outro.string_0045: As we know, I like having my partners be 'the woman' of a relationship.
outro.string_0046: As we know, I'm usually 'the woman' of a relationship.
outro.string_0047: As we know, I like taking turns at being 'the woman' of a relationship.
outro.string_0048: They raised me, showed me love, and I grew up to be a productive member of society.
outro.string_0049: And when you zoom in on this fractal, there's MORE fracked-up-ness.
outro.string_0054: I took Jack's advice and parodied Inception in my 'odd web game', Reimagine :The Game:.
outro.string_0055: Didn't say that Cobbs was awake in the ending, though.
outro.string_0056: Didn't say that the movie was all just a dream, though.
outro.string_0057: Still think it doesn't matter if Cobbs was still dreaming.
outro.string_0058: Reimagine :The Game: got internet-famous-ish! A good portfolio piece.
outro.string_0059: A few months later, I landed an internship at Electronic Arts in the Bay Area. Far away from my family in Canada.
outro.string_0061: I'm now repenting for my sins by making artsy-fartsy indie games like this one.
outro.string_0063: That's why they call it the Gay Area!
outro.string_0065: Yup! I didn't work on those, though. Our team was making a web game version of--
outro.string_0068: After EA, I went on to go indie.
outro.string_0069: But I stayed in touch with friends at EA, and stayed in the Bay Area.
outro.string_0072: And here... I'm finally starting to figure out my identity.
outro.string_0073: Well, I'm looking forward to Literally Cannot Disclose: The Game.
outro.string_0074: But seriously, no one calls it the Gay Area.
outro.string_0077: Claire, in an ironic twist of fate, was also bisexual.
outro.string_0078: We told each other about it during a {0} study session.
outro.string_0080: Claire was insecure about her sexual orientation, like me.
outro.string_0081: We were both somewhat inexperienced. Claire's only been with women, and I've only been with Jack.
outro.string_0082: Well, uh, all mirror images are reversed.
outro.string_0084: But yeah, Claire and I shared our experiences with one another.
outro.string_0085: No. She's like a sister to me. A sister I would not have sex with.
outro.string_0086: You... did not need to clarify that.
outro.string_0088: Like... do a 'come hither' motion with your fingers, or, rub the head against the roof of your mouth.
outro.string_0090: I did move to her school, in the end.
outro.string_0091: We were best friends. We still are! We've now both moved to the US, far away from our hateful families.
outro.string_0092: Together, we helped each other overcome our insecurities, and discover who we were...
outro.string_0094: What a touching story. I think.
outro.string_0095: And of course, we wingman/wingwoman for each other.
outro.string_0096: And that's the last of the post-coming-out stories!
outro.string_0097: Dear player, I couldn't help but notice...
outro.string_0098: You went straight for the Truth first.
outro.string_0099: You saved the Truth for last.
outro.string_0100: You wanted to hear the Lie first.
outro.string_0101: You saved the Lie for last.
outro.string_0102: What does that say about you?...
outro.string_0103: You know... usually when a game gives you multiple endings, they don't do them ALL AT ONCE.
outro.string_0104: Hah! You thought these were ENDINGS?
outro.string_0105: This is just the begi-- oh. Okay, yeah.
outro.string_0106: True... but the story, which is my story, my life, continues.
outro.string_0107: Don't worry. Your next choice is the very last one, I swear.
outro.string_0108: You know, if I could go back and relive all my other possible choices...
outro.string_0109: ... which in a sense, I did, by writing this game...
outro.string_0112: My texts getting read. Being forced to change schools. Getting punched in the face.
outro.string_0113: My texts getting read. Being forced to change schools. All the verbal abuse.
outro.string_0114: My texts getting read. Being forced to change schools. The attempted 'gay rehab' with Claire.
outro.string_0115: My texts getting read. No more after-school hours to myself. The attempted 'gay rehab' with Claire.
outro.string_0116: In a Stockholm Syndrome sort of sense... I'm grateful for it all.
outro.string_0118: I wouldn't have been so motivated to forge my own life... if my previous life wasn't total utter shit.
outro.string_0119: Later in 2010, Dan Savage launched the It Gets Better™ campaign.
outro.string_0120: My three stories... Lie, Truth, Half-Truth... they're all at least true about one thing.
outro.string_0124: Of this long, stupid, painful game...
outro.string_0125: Where I played against people who should have been on my side...
